name: rewritten_dreams
prompt: Each morning, people receive government-edited versions of their dreams. Write the reaction of someone who notices the change.
decoded:
I woke up this morning and noticed something strange. My dreams were different. They were clearer, more vivid, and more controlled. I couldn't shake the feeling that something was amiss. My mind was racing with questions: what was happening to my dreams? Why were they being edited? What was the government trying to achieve?

I tried to recall my dreams from the night before, but they were fuzzy and indistinct. I couldn't remember anything that hadn't been edited. I felt a sense of unease and paranoia. Was the government manipulating my thoughts? Were they trying to control my mind?

I decided to investigate. I searched online for information about government-edited dreams and found that it was a real phenomenon. Many people had reported that their dreams were being edited by the government. I realized that I wasn't alone in this, and I felt a sense of relief and solidarity.

I decided to speak out about it. I shared my experience with friends and family, and I started a petition to urge the government to stop editing people's dreams. I felt a sense of empowerment and determination. I knew that I had to do something to stop the government from manipulating people's dreams, and I was determined to make a difference.
